title: BufRead::split eats last separator

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
    let data = b"\nempty line:\n\ntrailing newline\n";
    let buf = BufReader::new(data.as_slice());
    let lines: Vec<_> = buf.split(b'\n').map(Result::unwrap).collect();
```

I expected to see this happen: each empty line in `data` corresponds to an empty element in `lines`: `lines == [b"", b"empty line:", b"", b"trailing newline", b""]`

Instead, this happened: the trailing newline is eaten: `lines == [b"", b"empty line:", b"", b"trailing newline"]`


Playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=04c3b5f7020f0abc7a802400127ba70a

This is quite annoying because this makes split an irreversible operation: information is lost and it is not possible to recover the content of the original buffer from its split content.

### Meta
Happens with stable and nightly on the playground, as well as my distro package (1.64):

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.64.0
binary: rustc
commit-hash: unknown
commit-date: unknown
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.64.0
LLVM version: 14.0.6

```
